required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Investigating the Efficacy and Safety of Insulin Degludec/Insulin Aspart Once Daily Plus Insulin Aspart for the Remaining Meals Versus Insulin Detemir Once or Twice Daily Plus Meal Time Insulin Aspart in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial Investigating the Efficacy and Safety of Insulin Degludec/Insulin Aspart Once Daily Plus Insulin Aspart for the Remaining Meals Versus Insulin Detemir Once or Twice Daily Plus Meal Time Insulin Aspart in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Asia, Europe and North and South America. The aim of the trial is to investigate the efficacy and safety of insulin degludec/insulin aspart once daily plus insulin aspart for the remaining meals in children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes mellitus.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) (%)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage point change in glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) from baseline (week 0) to 16 Weeks. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 16 weeks of treatment. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: A Treatment Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) was defined as an event with onset date on or after the first day of exposure to randomised treatment and no later than 7 days after the last day on randomised treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Treatment Emergent Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes (Plasma Glucose (PG) Below 3.1mmol/L (56mg/dL) or Severe Hypoglycaemia)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent hypoglycaemic episodes (PG < 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) or severe hypoglycaemia). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes were defined as episodes that were either: Severe (i.e. the child is having altered mental status and cannot assist in their care, is semiconscious or unconscious or in coma with or without convulsions and may require parenteral therapy (glucagon or i.v. glucose), or An episode biochemically confirmed by PG value of <3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL), with or without symptoms consistent with hypoglycaemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Treatment Emergent Nocturnal Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: The confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes occurring between 23:00 and 07:00 were considered for this endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hyperglycaemic Episodes (PG Above 14.0 mmol/L (250 mg/dL) Where Subject Looks/Feels Ill
secondary_outcome.description: The episode of hyperglycaemia was noted when the glucose measurement was 14.0mmol/L or above and the subject looked /felt ill.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hyperglycaemic Episodes (PG Above 14.0 mmol/L (250 mg/dL) Where Subject Looks/Feels Ill With Ketosis (Blood Ketones Above 1.5 mmol/L)
secondary_outcome.description: The episode of hyperglycaemia was noted when the glucose measurement was 14.0mmol/L or above and the subject looked /felt ill. The ketone meaurement involved an additional finger prick and ketosis was considered present if blood ketones were higher than 1.5mmol/L

intervention.description: Administered subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin) once daily with a main meal. Dose individually adjusted.
Administered s.c. with the remaining meals. Dose individually adjusted.

Administered s.c. once or twice daily. Dose individually adjusted. Subjects will continue with their pre-trial dosing scheme (once (OD) or twice daily (BID)) and will be allowed to switch from OD to BID dosing.
Administered s.c. at meal-times. Dose individually adjusted.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion Criteria: - Informed consent obtained before any trial related activities. Trial related activities are any procedures that are carried out as part of the trial, including activities to determine suitability for the trial - Subjects diagnosed with type 1 diabetes mellitus - HbA1c below or equal to 11.0% Exclusion Criteria: - Known hypoglycaemic unawareness or recurrent severe hypoglycaemic events as judged by the investigator - More than 1 episode of diabetic ketoacidosis requiring hospitalisation within the last 3 months prior to Visit 1 (Screening) - Any chronic disorder or significant concomitant disease, which in the investigator's opinion might jeopardise the subject's safety or compliance with the protocol

removed_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

reference.citation: Thalange N, Deeb L, Klingensmith G, Franco DR, Bardtrum L, Tutkunkardas D, Danne T. The rate of hyperglycemia and ketosis with insulin degludec-based treatment compared with insulin detemir in pediatric patients with type 1 diabetes: An analysis of data from two randomized trials. Pediatr Diabetes. 2019 May;20(3):314-320. doi: 10.1111/pedi.12821. Epub 2019 Feb 10.

results_reference.citation: Battelino T, Deeb LC, Ekelund M, Kinduryte O, Klingensmith GJ, Kocova M, Kovarenko M, Shehadeh N. Efficacy and safety of a fixed combination of insulin degludec/insulin aspart in children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes: A randomized trial. Pediatr Diabetes. 2018 Nov;19(7):1263-1270. doi: 10.1111/pedi.12724. Epub 2018 Aug 16.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial was conducted at 63 sites in 14 countries as follows: Belgium: 3 sites; Brazil: 1 sites; Canada: 3 sites; Czech Republic 3 sites; Croatia: 2 sites; Israel: 6 sites; Macedonia: 2 sites; Poland: 3 sites; Russia: 5 sites; Serbia: 4 sites; Slovenia: 1 sites; South Africa: 2 sites; Spain: 5 sites; and United States: 23 sites.

group.title: IDegAsp OD
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) once daily (OD) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 1-3 times daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: IDet OD/BID
group.description: Insulin detemir (IDet) OD/BID (once daily /twice daily) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 2-4 times daily for 16 weeks

participants_list.participants: One subject was withdrawn before exposure.
One subject was withdrawn before exposure

baseline.population: The Full Analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects.

group.title: IDegAsp OD
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) once daily (OD) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 1-3 times daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: IDet OD/BID
group.description: Insulin detemir (IDet) OD/BID (once daily /twice daily) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 2-4 times daily for 16 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Fasting plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.description: Capillary blood samples for fasting plasma glucose (FPG) were taken either at home or at the clinic in the morning on the day of visits 2, 14 and 18 by use of a home blood sampling kit. At baseline FPG assessment: IDegAsp OD: 172 subjects, IDet: 166 subjects. In total: 338 subjects

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) (%)
outcome.description: Percentage point change in glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) from baseline (week 0) to 16 Weeks. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all randomised subjects. 20 subjects were withdrawn and only 4 subjects though completed the study did not have assesments.

group.title: IDegAsp OD
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) once daily (OD) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 1-3 times daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: IDet OD/BID
group.description: Insulin detemir (IDet) OD/BID (once daily /twice daily) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 2-4 times daily for 16 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) (%)
measure.description: Percentage point change in glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) from baseline (week 0) to 16 Weeks. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.
measure.population: The FAS included all randomised subjects. 20 subjects were withdrawn and only 4 subjects though completed the study did not have assesments.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose
outcome.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 16 weeks of treatment. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all randomised subjects. 338 subjects had assessment at baseline, 326 had assessment at week 16, 2 subjects were withdrawn before exposure and 22 subjects week 16 assessment was not done.

group.title: IDegAsp OD
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) once daily (OD) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 1-3 times daily for 16 weeks.

group.description: Insulin detemir (IDet) OD/BID (once daily /twice daily) 2-4U was administered subcutaneously in the thigh, upper arm (deltoid area) or abdomen with the main meal and IAsp was given with the remaining meals 2-4 times daily for 16 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose
measure.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 16 weeks of treatment. Change from baseline summary statistics at week 16 contains only those who had both baseline and week 16 assesment.
measure.population: The FAS included all randomised subjects. 338 subjects had assessment at baseline, 326 had assessment at week 16, 2 subjects were withdrawn before exposure and 22 subjects week 16 assessment was not done.

outcome.title: Incidence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: A Treatment Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) was defined as an event with onset date on or after the first day of exposure to randomised treatment and no later than 7 days after the last day on randomised treatment.
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set (SAS) included all subjects receiving at least one dose of the trial product or its comparator

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of plans by any investigator to publish and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol. Any such communication must be submitted in writing to Novo Nordisk before submission for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the planned communication
